author: Kate A.
text:
The mark of a decent organisation is how it responds when there are issues. I've bought before from VC and had no problems but my most recent experience has put me off ever buying from them again.
I purchased a coat, which, on arrival (having swallowed the extortionate shipping and duty costs) had clearly been taken in at the sides.
I raised a complaint and sent it back, only to be told that, in their opinion, the item met the description. It didn't but I have no further recourse so now I either accept them selling it, minus the duty charge, the shipping AND their fee (which means I'll be lucky to see half of what I paid), or have it returned to me.
In order to get it returned you have to make the request within 24 hours. And that requires that there's someone their end to speak to. I've been on their Chat for the last hour, being promised that "waiting time is less than a minute" so who knows if I'll ever see the garment again. 
My impression is that they've grown beyond their capacity to manage their inventory and are taking their customers hugely for granted. I'd rather take my chances with eBay in future - at least buyers have some protections there!
title: Avoid, avoid, avoid. Buyers have zero protection

author: Kate O
text: Since VC started using Hermes Courier to deliver Direct Shipping sales within the UK, it's all gone wrong. They used to use DHL which was stupidly expensive, and I can't count the number of times I responded to their surveys asking them to use Royal Mail in the UK. Hermes is dire and I currently have two VC parcels which they have failed to deliver. Hermes is a bottom of the barrel courier and not in line with the luxury image that VC aims to portray. I give their use of Hermes in the UK another 6 months before they realise, like everyone else, that it's not worth the hassle. Vestiaire Collective - please move to Royal Mail or at least back to DHL for UK domestic direct shipping sales!
title: Wish that VC would STOP using Hermes for UK Deliveries

author: D Bullas
text:
I am owed £157.50 from the sale of my bag on 18 Dec and the alleged process of my payment on 22 Jan.  I did not receive payment therefore I shipped my valuable bag but have not been paid for it.  I have instigated numerous on-line chats and emails to Customer Services and am getting nowhere 3 weeks after payment was allegedly made but “stuck in the system due to a technical error’!!.  I was also told the exceptional circumstances need to be looked into and I am constantly fobbed-off by generic holding emails.  The bottom line is they have not paid me and whatever problem they have at their end is not my concern.  This is despicable business practice and I will seek legal action.  I will never buy or sell via this site again and warn others to stay clear of it.

18 Jan - review edit: Well isn't it amazing that I get a response from Vestiaire Collective on a public review site but cannot get a response from my numerous (c. x20) emails communications to Customer Services and the On Line chat facility involving x7 named operatives!  They all continue to ignore my pleas to be paid and neither have they responded to my emailed proof of not being paid - I attached the relevant bank statement and bank account screenshots of incoming transactions over the expected payment period.  During one of my communications with on-line chat, one of the named operatives apologised that my payment was “stuck in the system due to a technical issue” - so what is their story?.  I have not been paid.  I am owed £157.50 for for sale of my beautiful Alexander Wang bag.  The buyer has the bag and Vestiaire Collective received the payment from the buyer but I - the seller and Vestiaire Collective’s ‘bread and butter’ - have not received my due amount of this business transaction.  It’s appalling how much time and effort I have had to put into trying to get paid.  It’s impossible to speak to anyone on the phone so they hide behind e-comms. 
I hope my appalling experience of Vestiaire Collective is a warning to others.

Final edit/update - on 31 Jan I was eventually paid the money owed to me since 18 Dec but only after numerous further pleas from me to the On-line Chat facility.  The operative sent me a screenshot confirming payment to the (wrong) ex-bank account which in fact clearly stated ‘Status - De-activated’ but VC still would not accept they hadn’t paid me (no further mention of the monies ‘being stuck in the system’).  I had to ask Tesco Bank to write a letter to me confirming no payment had been received, which I scanned & sent to VC.  A week later - after I’d chased up an acknowledgement - VC asked me to delete my (correct) bank account details and re-enter them, even though they had paid into the correct bank account since 18 Dec for a 2nd sale.
I’ve had no unsolicited contact fro their Customer Services nor an apology. 
I’ve now cancelled my account with Vestiaire Collective.

author: D. L.
text:
Total scam..
I sold a bag, the shipping was from Germany to France. As it arrived in Paris the UPS tracking said the order was canceled by the buyer (I contacted the buyer and he said he never canceled..). However here comes the problem, bag was supposed to come back to me.. After a couple of days I saw that the UPS tracking was updated to deliver to the seller, but it was not deliver to me (it was address in Saarbrücken, i live far away from this city). I contacted the support, the worst support in the world, wrote 20 times with them, exchanged emails, sadly for me send them my ID (which is so stupid from my side..). They wanted also handwritten statement?! and all sorts of other documents.. After a month I received an email, stating that they spoke to UPS and the item has been delivered to me a couple of weeks ago, I have updated my shipping address to Saarbrücken.. Talked with UPS about the issues and the adress in Saarbrücken, to which my item was delivered is a warehouse from Vestiaire Collective.. Haha
P.S. IMPORTANT In one of my first chats with them they stated they don't have a warehouse in Germany and it is supposedly warehouse from UPS (another lie from Vestiaire). In my last chat with the support, after I told i will sue them they said that if the item is received in their warehouse in Saarbrücken they will send it back to me. They think their customers are stupid or something. When I confronted them about this lie they said it is brand new and they just opened it.. What a joke. 
Vestiaire Collective GmbH
Lebacher Str. 4
66113 Saarbrücken
Germany

text: Purchased a fake jacket authenticated as real, sent 4 emails about it and was ignored for 10 days. Finally got a response to my in depth email with full pictures comparing it to an authentic version in full detail. They said they would send it off for a second authentication, it was marked as authentic(wrongly) and automatically listed for sale again on my page? I deleted it for sale when I realised but somehow it still sold to a new buyer - passing a fake on when I tried so hard to just get a refund. It took to me writing a lengthy complaint on their Facebook page to finally get them to accept it was fake and refund me - plus get the new buyer to return it and finally - deal with the original seller of the jacket. All in all TERRIBLE plus their authentication is nothing more than rubbish greenwashing to look good. The whole thing wasted about 4 hours of my time and I was never given an apology (I had been a very regular customer of the site up til that point)
